meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a stick or rod.
meanings.sent1: He yerd the drum with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She yerd the pinata until it broke open.
meanings.sent3: The chef yerd the dough to make it fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The waves yerd against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith yerd the metal into shape.

meanings.definition: A unit of linear measurement equal to three feet.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the board with a yerd.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was sold by the yerd at the store.
meanings.sent3: The tailor used a yerd of cloth to make the dress.
meanings.sent4: The garden was as long as a yerdstick.
meanings.sent5: The road stretched out for many yerds ahead.
